Desc.entry:
Sheffield Homes is an ALMO (Arms Length Organisation) providing a social housing service for Sheffield City Council. Offers accommodation for older people who enjoy living independently . Provides comfortable, secure accommodation in a relaxed environment, where people can have their own front door to come and go as they please. The different property types are self-contained flats, studio apartments and bungalows. Communal facilities include laundry, kitchen, a lounge for social activities and tended gardens. Provides a warden service and all accommodation is linked to City Wide Care Alarms (see separate entry).
To be eligible to apply applicants must be aged 60 years and over. In the case of couples one person must be aged 60 years and over. Applicants with a physical or learning disability can apply at age 55 years and over. Customers apply for properties via the Council's choice based letting system.
